page.title: 18LITTER IN CROYDON
page.content: 90,000 tonnes of rubbish from 130,000 premises is collected every year from the Croydon area, and most of it ends up in Factory Lane Depot. All the boroughs' vehicles are based at Stubbs Mead (main entrance Factory Lane). When it is windy the rubbish swirls around the area, and when it is warm it is very smelly. When the dump is closed thoughtless people put their rubbish outside the gates and along Factory Lane. Road cleaning is messy and hard work, but we have electric vans with brushes on the front. They go on the pavements and roads making a special sweep on Saturdays around the centre of Croydon. Litter is a big problem all over the country. In Croydon, people from the M.S.C. are visiting schools and helping to keep our area pleasant to live in.
